feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud - Lock Year Column in SAC Excel AddIn
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We would like to lock the Year column so that data entry is only possible for Months. We solved this by using styling rules.

Unfortunately, styling rules cannot be used in the SAC Excel Add-In. Does anyone have an idea on how to achieve this requirement?

Kind regards,
Ismail

entry.title: SAC Story Filters: Profit Center & Product – Dependent Access Query
entry.content:
Hi All,

We have two public dimensions Profit Center and Product added both as a story filter and enabled Data Access Control for the Profit Center dimension, giving access based on their Business Area say (A, B, C, D, E) and user access is set so they only see profit centers linked to their Business Area.

Current behavior:
Users see only the profit centers they’re permitted to access. However, our goal is for users to select a profit center and then have the Product filter dynamically show only the products associated with that profit center rather than displaying all products.

for example, suppose a user in Business Area 'B' sees only “Ducati” as their profit center. When they choose Ducati, the Product filter should then only offer options like “Panigale V4” and “Monster,” which are explicitly linked to Ducati, instead of showing products linked to other profit centers.

So, to achieve should we enable Data Access Control for the Product dimension as well, so users see only products related to their assigned profit centers? Or is there a more efficient way to implement linked filters using standard SAC functionality, without relying on JavaScript?

Thanks.

entry.title: Apache Tomcat upgrade for SAP Analytics Cloud (9.0.44 to one the latest Apache Tomcat 9.0.x version)
entry.content:
Hello everyone

we are using SAP Analytics Cloud installed starting from SAC Kit Agent cloudagent 1.0.339 version.

It installed, as part of this software package, also Apache Tomcat version 9.0.44 and JVM 8 on the server.

Now, we received a security vulnerability threat report and the security team has suggested to upgrade at least to 9.0.98 Tomcat version on the server.

So we would like to install this Tomcat version (that is a minor Tomcat upgrade because it's inside the 9.0.x family), and we have seen using a compatibility matrix, that JVM 8 remains compatible, and so we would like to upgrade to 9.0.108 version.

My question is: when upgrading to 9.0.108 Tomcat version , will the installed version of SAC remain fully compatible with this new version of Tomcat?

If not, please kindly suggest how to proceed how to achieve compatibility between SAC and Tomcat

Thank you so much, any comment will be appreciate

entry.title: SAC optimised story using a live connection - no data to fetch using restricted calculated measures
entry.content:
Just wondering if anyone else has seen this behaviour,

As an example I create a restricted measure e.g.
Sales Revenue restricted by Dimension Country = UK

so really simple,  but it always returns no data to fetch.

Yet if I simply add the Sales Revenue to say a numeric point chart, then add the Country Dimension as a filter = UK   the measure shows data as expected.

really weird....

entry.title: how to start learning SAP - trainings, courses
entry.content:
Hi everybody, 

I’m new here and I have a question. I want to learn SAP and am new to this technology. Yes, I know it’s pretty tough with a lot to learn. But I want to do it because I want to change my profile. My background is data warehouse development, data modeling, and ETL development. Here I want to pivot instead of diving deeper into AWS or Azure cloud; I want to learn SAP, maybe SAP BTP and Cloud.

What do you think? Are these good topics for the future and with my background? Is there anyone here who can offer advice on which courses and trainings to start with for an introduction?

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for Direct Tax Calculation & Reporting
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm currently exploring the capabilities of SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and its potential application in the realm of direct tax calculation and reporting for a potential customer here in Italy.

I'm particularly interested in understanding:

- Existing Templates/Accelerators: Have any members successfully implemented SAC for direct tax, and are there any available accelerators, templates, content packages, or success stories you can share?

I understand how complex and volatile the tax regulatory landscape is, but any support, insights, experiences, documentation, or links to relevant SAP blogs/articles would be highly appreciated.

 

Thank you in advance for your time and expertise!

Best regards,
Andrea

entry.title: How to create 2 input control filters dependent on each other in story
entry.content:
Kindly help me on below requirement please;

suppose I have 2 Dimensions as shared in below screenshots:

Profitcenter (attribute is Group)

Projectcode ((attribute is Group)

Requirement is I need to apply 2 input control filters on each dim above in my input form in story but Profit center values should be dependent on project code selection ..e.g.. if we select projectcode= PP_SRW then the respective profit center should be seen/ selected only…i.e.. PB_SRW, 0569A00000,0569B00000 (but NOT 0123A00000 as its under PP_XXX attribute of profitcenter which is diff from PB_SRW) and accordingly my table data should be filtered.

I already tried with Dataaction with below script but somehow its not writing value (1*0=0) in form. ALso not sure if this is the correct approach for above requirement .

entry.title: Polaris Integration with SAC Planning - Documentation & Best Practice
entry.content:
Hi,

I wanted to check if anyone has experience or documentation on integrating Polaris with SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Planning. If you have any guides, reference documents, or lessons learned from a previous implementation, could you guide me on this

Additionally, I’d appreciate any tips or key considerations to keep in mind for establishing a seamless data flow between Polaris and SAC

Thanks,

Vinay

entry.title: SAC Application script, chart onselect value passing into url parameter
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am trying to capture the selected dimension value from a chart. This value i am trying to pass into URL parameter to child report. 
Value is getting passed to child report but data is not getting filtered. 

I have created script variable "RegionFilter" both in parent report and child report. 

When i am passign the parameter value from a Dropdown or Check box, data is getting filter in child report, but with chart it is not working. 
Parent report parameter passing url :- 

NavigationUtils.openStory("9E218282F57BE2D4EBBC6959FE0D0AB1", "a31b3cd2-f023-4b22-ac46-3e90b81c8e7a",
[UrlParameter.create("p_RegionFilter",CB_Country.getSelectedKeys().join("|")),UrlParameter.create("p_MaterialFilter",List_Material.getSelectedKeys().join("|"))]);

Child report logic to apply filter :-

RegionFilter;
console.log(RegionFilter);
 
if (RegionFilter==="ALL") {
console.log(RegionFilter);
Table_1.getDataSource().removeDimensionFilter("Country");
}
else if (RegionFilter!=="ALL") {
console.log("Chart selected value ... "+ RegionFilter);
Table_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter("Country",RegionFilter.split("|"));
}
 
Can anyone of you please help me in this.
Thanks,
Subash

entry.title: How to read from filtered dimension from data point selection in SAC?
entry.content:
Dear all,

I have a requirement to  show the selected dimension from data point selection on a chart such as below. I can only read if the dimension is properly filtered but no luck finding at data point selection.  Has anyone a solution? Thanks in advance!

entry.title: SAC Application script : Pop up button onclick code not working
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am trying with code like, when we click on cancel button what ever the bookmark which has been added to Dropdown box should get deleted.

When we click on save button what ever the bookmark name given in input field, is get added to dropdown box. 
I am looking for functionality like, when we click on cancel button what ever the bookmark name added to dropdown box should get delete. 
I am trying with below code for this ..

if (ListBox_1.getSelectedKey()==="Personal") {
console.log(ListBox_1.getSelectedKey());
console.log("SV_BKM_P value is "+SV_BMK_Personal);
var bmk = SV_BMK_Personal;
var bookmark = "P_"+SV_BMK_Personal;
console.log(bookmark);
console.log("Clicked on Cancel");
if (buttonId === "Cancel") {
Bookmarks.deleteBookmark(bookmark);
if (SV_Personal_ID.includes(bmk)) {
var number = SV_Personal_ID.indexOf(SV_BMK_Personal);
var id = SV_Personal_ID.substring(0,number-2);
DD_Personal.removeItem(id);
console.log(id);
}
POP_Up.close();
}  
else if (buttonId ==="OK") {
console.log("Clicked on OK");
POP_Up.close();
} }
 
else if (ListBox_1.getSelectedKey()==="Global") {
if (buttonId==="Cancel") {
var bmk1 = SV_BMK_Global;
var bookmakr1 = "G_"+bmk1;
Bookmarks.deleteBookmark(bookmakr1);
POP_Up.close();
}
else if (buttonId==="OK") {
POP_Up.close();
}
}
 
But my code is not working as expected like, when i am clicking on cancel button bookmark it not getting deleted from dropdown box.
Can anyone of you please help me on this.

Thanks

entry.title: Handling YTD and Previous Month Selection in SAC
entry.content:
In SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), I have a report based on SAP ECC / S/4 HANA with a Month_Year filter. Currently, selecting a month (e.g., June 2025) shows:

  • Current Value:  June 2025 

  • Previous Value: May 2025

The client now wants two separate filters:

  1. Current Month-Year (e.g., June 2025) → display YTD from Jan to selected month

  2. Previous Month-Year (e.g., May 2024) → display only the selected previous month

    I have created calculation input control but it doesn't provides YTD .

How can we implement this in SAC so that both filters work independently and show the expected values?

entry.title: Exporting Plan Data from SAC to SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We want to export planning data from our SAC Model to S/4HANA and more specific, to ACDOCP. As we can see, there is only one export method available: Clean and Replace.

However, we do not wish to delete the existing records of ACDOCP. 

Is there any way, that we can export our data to ACDOCP without deleting any of the other records?

Thank you in advance for you help!

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: SAP analytic Model disappeared
entry.content: We have a story based on two models. Today the story does not work. It says the models are not there. looked through activity log and could not find anything deleted. We have the model ID.  How to retrieve them and why did it happen?

entry.title: How to Load Exchange Rate Types from S/4 TCURR in SAC?
entry.content:
I am trying to create an exchange rate model using S/4 TCURR content in SAC. We load a view using OData Connection from  Datasphere.

Scenario:
- S/4

    - We have many exchange rate types in S/4 (> than 20)

    - TCURR-KURST (Types): For example: EUROX, M, (3-5 Budget rates) and so on...

- SAC:

    - rates: average and closing

    - categories: Actual, Budget, Planning, Forecast, Specific...

 

Rate Type

Rate Version

 

 

 

QUESTION:

- How to load the content in SAC? What is the technical approach to get this requirement done in SAC?

- Should we:

    - create more currency conversion models?

    - Filter only the relevant types for the planning process?

 

Thanks in advance for any input.

Carlos

entry.title: Is there a way to dynamically change the names and legends of measure items in SAC?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

Is there a way to dynamically change the names and legends of measure items in SAC?

For example, suppose you have a numerical item called measure and want to display that measure item as a line graph broken down by fiscal year.
You can display a legend on a line chart, but I want the legend to show the fiscal year, such as “measure(2020)” and “measure(2021)”.

I want to display the fiscal year in the parentheses. Is it possible to dynamically specify the fiscal year?
Dynamic means that when data for fiscal year 2025 is newly added, “measure(2025)” will be added without requiring any editing operations.

The image below represents the desired outcome.
The image display uses a calculated measure to create a numerical value field named “measure(2020)”, but this method cannot be considered dynamic.


If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.
If you need additional information, please let us know in the comments.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: SAC Application script multi selection in table onSelect script
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am trying to do multi selection of values which has to pass to filter the data in other widgets.
I wrote the below code in onSelect of table.

var select = Source_Obj.getSelections();
console.log(select);
if (select.length>0) {
var members = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string);
for (var i=0; i<select.length; i++) {
for (var dimen in select[i]) {
if (dimen===Dim) {
members[i] = select[i][dimen];
console.log(members[i]);
}
}
}
console.log("member are ... "+members.join("|"));
Target_Obj.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter("Country",members);
}

But multi selection ia happening only with Ctrl + selection. 
Is there any way to do this multi selection with out Ctrl key.
 
Can anyone please help me on this.

Thanks in advance...

entry.title: Adding calculated rows in SAP Analytics Cloud table for lightweight calculations
entry.content:
I am working on a P&L statement with several category trees. For example Expenses Category can include child-members such as: COGS, SG&A, and Depreciation & Amortization.

SAC has automatically summed up each category (tree) group.

In this case, I am trying to sum-up or subtract two (2) or more categories trees depending on the required calculation. My expectation is to display the calculated measure’s name e.g. Net Income and value below the used/existing measures. See example:

>Revenue

100

>Expenses

50

Net Income

50

Currently no values are been displayed only the formula cell references e.g. =A5-A6 or Sum (A5, A6). See attached the screenshots. Please note that (all) represents the totals of the entire column

The primary data is from an on-premise BW system and a flat file (blended data). SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) tenant is not using a planning license.

entry.title: Implementing a Dynamic YTD Filter Up to Yesterday in SAP Story
entry.content:
Hi all,

I want to set up a dynamic YTD filter in an SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) story that always goes up to the previous day. The goal is for the filter to automatically consider the current year, but have the end date update daily.

Important: On the first day of the month, the filter should show the last day of the previous month, not the current month’s first day

I tried to use the Offset  function for selecting the previous day but this didnt work when I try to Show YTD for the current year.

Best,

Moritz
